column4: Outdoor Network is hiring! For Albany to gain 100 new jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic is wonderful. I will continue supporting efforts to create new jobs and prosperity for Albany and the rest of our district. https://t.co/LZYR5zO8dN

One of the most important things to me as the Ag Approps Chairman is making sure the crops we grow in GA continue their massive contributions to our economies. Pecans & peanuts are very healthy & are also two of our largest agricultural exports as a state. https://t.co/QVLfhdKecz https://t.co/TV3pEycS4w

#2020Census data is vital to helping our communities thrive. It helps us obtain the healthcare, transportation, schools, affordable housing, & higher education that our families need to get a good start & succeed.  Complete yours at https://t.co/ztL61WjGr8 by 10/31.  #BeCounted

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris will take place on October 9th! 
This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD 
 
To register, go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/jTILzkUbat

I will keep the President, First Lady, and every American who has been infected with this terrible virus in my thoughts and prayers. This virus is not a hoax or joke. Wear a mask, follow CDC guidelines, and stay safe.

As the pandemic goes on, it’s clear that we need a response to support our citizens & combat this virus. The updated Heroes Act reflects these priorities, & I'm proud to support it. I urge the Senate & President to support this bill to help our nation. https://t.co/kDdpFv4was

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris will take place on October 9th! 
This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD.

To register, go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/2rNilP3Fo4

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris  will take place on October 9th! 
This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD

To register, go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/Jf8oncikHu

The virtual 2020 Military Family Caucus Summit w/ Rep. @cathymcmorris will take place on October 9th! 
This year’s Summit will focus on COVID-19’s impact on our nation's military families & will feature keynote remarks from @EsperDoD 

To register, go to https://t.co/mGR1aMrxBb https://t.co/eu1w9SDmzG

Space is limited & appointments are required. Pre-scheduled testing is available for employees of DoCo School System by calling 706-721-9740. All other individuals should call 706-721-4905 to schedule an appointment.

The City of Albany, Dougherty County (DoCo), & the DoCo School System are partnering w/ @AUG_University Health to offer COVID-19 antibody testing to Albany & DoCo residents. Testing will take place from Sept. 16-29 at the Albany Civic Center, 100 W. Oglethorpe Blvd.

I am pleased with the measures @FortBenning has taken to ensure the safety of their soldiers, families, and personnel. The pandemic has not delayed their plans for improving impact readiness, as they build a new air traffic controller tower and storm water system. https://t.co/2OgT7NeWbr

I’m proud to see that progress is being made to develop a more accessible clinic in the downtown Columbus area for displaced Vets who need access to primary medical care/mental health services. I would also like to thank @SecWilkie from @DeptVetAffairs for his support. https://t.co/ZgskFi44be

Attention high school students! The ACT & SAT are adding additional test dates in the fall to add capacity for standardized testing due to earlier cancellation of tests due to COVID!

For more info, visit https://t.co/ZVvMqLqB5y & https://t.co/sC2g0k5I5l

Today, I toured the @USPS Macon P&D Center to see the recent policy changes’ impact on their service level. We need a fully functioning Postal Service to keep America safe & secure, especially during an election year where more Americans will be voting by mail bc of the pandemic. https://t.co/fZoPjV1Wys

For 85 yrs, #SocialSecurity has provided economic security for millions of Americans. We must recommit ourselves to enhancing & protecting this vital program by passing  #HR7499, Social Security COVID-19 Correction and Equity Act, which would expand benefits during the pandemic! https://t.co/bgvyUaDXZW

I’m always happy to help @FVSU distribute meal prep materials to those in need through @USDA’s  Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Everyone should have access to high-quality & nutritious products and produce especially during these difficult times. https://t.co/cXGxIW04Qu

Today, @usdaRMA announced it will authorize Approved Insurance Providers to extend deadlines for premium/admin payments, defer the resulting interest accrual, & allow other flexibilities to help farmers, ranchers, & insurance providers due to COVID-19. https://t.co/fyaEzwML7a

For our 2nd minibus, I believe we've come up w/ a good bill that will make strong investments in America’s future during this pandemic & beyond. I urge the Senate to pass it quickly so Americans can see the benefits faster. https://t.co/t2I5X8jpGg

COVID-19 has expanded the need for telehealth & tele-education solutions everywhere, especially in rural & low-income areas that still lag behind more populated areas in their ability to virtually connect with teachers, doctors, & other essential services. #RuralBroadbandDay

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector, increasing forced closures & the shortage of quality, affordable care. H.R. 7027 & H.R. 7327 will:

- Provide grant funds to providers 
- Provide tuition/co-payment relief to families
- Prioritize providers in underserved populations https://t.co/ofyE7Cl40f

I'm proud to join my colleagues, @RepGraceMeng & @RepEspaillat, in this bipartisan effort to include language in the next relief package that would allow SNAP recipients to use their EBT cards to purchase hot food for the duration of the pandemic. https://t.co/q84OHit07A

ATTN HS students! The ACT & SAT are adding additional test dates in the fall & attempting to expand testing sites to add capacity for standardized testing due to earlier cancellation of tests due to COVID.  
For more info, visit https://t.co/ZVvMqLqB5y & https://t.co/sC2g0k5I5l

I’m pleased the full House Approps Committee worked together to support Americans in this difficult time. Our bill touches every American’s life, which is why we rejected the Administration’s proposed massive cuts that would be cruel during the pandemic. https://t.co/OSYPFYnCit

For the thousands of beneficiaries in GA that need dialysis or COVID-19 testing, access to Medicaid NEMT is a matter of life & death. I want to commend Chairwoman Rosa DeLauro (D-CT) for including this provision in her FY 2021 appropriations legislation. 
https://t.co/idyvY0kp9L

Once again, our bill rejects the Administration’s drastic cuts and instead builds on the four COVID-19 supplemental bills Congress passed this spring by providing funding increases for our rural communities, vulnerable populations, and essential workers.  https://t.co/xo3rIKRQPE

The Patient Protection & Affordable Care Enhancement Act builds on the ACA's progress to protect people w/ pre-existing conditions, lower costs, & expand care. Improving our healthcare system, lowering costs, & expanding Medicaid is the right move. https://t.co/6Bsd63QP1C

Today, @usdafsa announced that they will now accept applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) through an online portal. 

For more info, visit https://t.co/00k4pqfJOw

Less than 1% of the U.S. has tested (+) for COVID-19 & almost 8.5% of Vets have tested (+). It’s urgent that a Community-Based Outpatient Clinic (CBOC) be provided in the Columbus region to enable the VA to provide increased & safer healthcare for Vets. https://t.co/DijDZwV98w

I returned to DC this week to do the people’s business. For the first time in weeks, we voted on bills that were not COVID-19 related. The legislation we passed today will help struggling small businesses & vets trying to feed themselves & their families. https://t.co/4DAyAQ2ajd

Today our nation reached the tragic milestone of 100,000 lives taken by COVID-19. Every victim left behind dreams & loved ones grappling w/ the sudden void. To all who are grieving, I’m grieving with you. The loss to our nation is indescribable. 
https://t.co/uNPnf9Rky9

An alarming number of Americans have died, have been infected, & have lost their jobs—because of COVID-19. A public health crisis of this magnitude isn’t something we see often which is why we must act to help our citizens and reopen the nation safely. https://t.co/cQ3X5HAK1S

Today, USDA will host a webinar for farmers, ranchers, & other producers interested in applying for direct payments through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. 
 
For more info, visit https://t.co/QCUOGzMv13
Our nation is nearing 83,000 deaths from COVID-19 in only two months. My heart goes out to all who have lost a loved one during this crisis. Their lives will not be forgotten.

Our nation’s nurses have shown us time and time again what true dedication, compassion, and hard work really mean. 
 
This #NationalNursesWeek, we must honor our health care professionals by making sure they have the resources they need to save lives. 🏥 https://t.co/WGz3K5jb8Y

The fastest way to make it through this crisis is citizens protecting themselves by staying at home & widespread testing & tracing. We can and will make it through this pandemic, but we must continue to work together & #StayHomeToSaveLives

COVID-19 is far from gone & is likely more widespread than we know currently due to a lack of testing & asymptomatic spreaders. Since yesterday, there have been 1,000 new cases diagnosed in GA & a total of 319 people in GA-02 have lost their lives to this terrible disease.

Widespread testing is the key to making our way through this crisis. Everyone is encouraged to go to the new free drive-through testing site behind the Albany Civic Center. Details about how to do so are in the article. https://t.co/wqJFO1t7nW

As the pandemic continues, funding is needed for small businesses, hospitals, health care workers, & testing to get our lives back on track. H.R. 266 is another bipartisan measure to support our nation as we fight to defeat this virus.   https://t.co/DKPfQQrrbf

I’m deeply concerned about the Governor’s decision to reopen GA. We’ve seen a decrease in hospitalizations due to sheltering-in-place & social distancing. W/o testing & tracing, I fear reopening too soon will only lead to more grief. https://t.co/opkN98CSM3

Practicing social distancing & proper sanitation methods while grocery shopping is vital to stopping the spread of COVID-19 & food-borne illnesses. Follow these important tips from @US_FDA to learn more about how to protect yourself & others. https://t.co/wXblVhTlvD

I joined my colleagues,@RepDougCollins & @AustinScottGA08 ,  in sending a letter to Windstream Technologies urging them to increase rural broadband access for rural Georgians who are now working from home due to the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/wGQNh1Vgt7

Haven’t filled out the #Census2020 yet? Want to help your community access resources for hospitals 🏥, schools 📒, and infrastructure 🚅? 

Paper forms will be mailed to households this week. 

You can also respond now at https://t.co/ztL61WjGr8 https://t.co/FnfBqdFRf1

The COVID-19 outbreak in GA-02 is concerning to all of us & finding the right information can be difficult. My office has compiled a # of federal, state, & county resources available to Georgians impacted by this crisis. 
https://t.co/ZOdKNbcquo

The COVID-19 outbreak has changed our lives & affected every aspect of our nation. We are facing an extreme public health emergency & we have invested billions into helping those who've been hit the hardest by the virus’ impact. https://t.co/JH6LABX5Ho

I’m thankful to @Phoebe_Putney's response team for their tireless work in treating the growing # of COVID patients in GA02 & surrounding areas. Along w/ the funding bill to address this crisis, & I'll continue to assist in providing resources to all those who've been affected. https://t.co/BelBJroPun

Cancelling SNAP benefits for 700,000 during the coronavirus outbreak is cruel & endangers everyone. Do you choose to work & eat or not eat & self-quarantine for 2 weeks? USDA should suspend the rule change until COVID-19 is contained—not push the decision to states #SNAPworks https://t.co/JMG7icPGpY

After the recent illnesses & deaths from coronavirus, America needed a response to protect our health. I'm pleased w/ the comprehensive funding package, that includes vaccine development, support for state/local govs, & assistance for affected businesses. https://t.co/9Xc4q6fSst
As we kick-off  #NationalKidneyMonth, make sure you monitor your health and take the necessary steps to protect your kidneys by managing your blood pressure! https://t.co/ahptRJe0ej

ATTENTION SENIORS: Medicare open enrollment period ends on December 7. Please take advantage of free federal and state resources like Medicare Plan Finder & GeorgiaCares to find SAVINGS ON HEALTH INSURANCE PLANS AND PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION.

House-passed spending legislation invests in school lunch and breakfast programs to ensure our children have access to healthy, nutritious food. Tune in at 10 AM as @AppropsDems & I protect these vital programs. #WorldFoodDay https://t.co/IiZ12Amiab

Substance use & mental health disorders don’t discriminate. These issues affect us all, which is why we must work together to support those in recovery. I’m proud to support #NationalRecoveryMonth today with my colleagues in Congress. https://t.co/rtrFUHwZkT

I’m pleased to support H.R. 987, which would strengthen the ACA & ensure that all Americans - especially those w/ pre-existing conditions - receive outstanding health care benefits. https://t.co/98tVJxPigo

NEMT is an essential component of our nation’s health care delivery system, especially in rural areas. According to a recent Kaiser study, over half of Medicaid transportation services are utilized by patients with the highest burden of chronic diseases. https://t.co/tYVSmDqeSZ

My office is a strong supporter of Food and Agriculture Service Learning Program (FASLP) grants, which connect kids to healthy food in school, so they can lead healthier lives & reach their full potential. https://t.co/BIAdywoETI

Quality health care for veterans means a comprehensive approach, with a focus on physical, mental, emotional, & spiritual well-being. This morning, our Military Construction-VA Subcommittee will hear from @DeptVetAffairs about their whole health efforts → https://t.co/5koM65cIf3

I am proud to join my colleagues in supporting the Veteran’s Access to Child Care Act. Veterans should never have to choose their healthcare over the care of their child. #ChildCare4Vets https://t.co/kejQECIyr1

The funds awarded to Valley Healthcare System in Columbus will help residents in the Chattahoochee Valley Area receive the quality health care they need & deserve. I thank @HHSGov for their commitment to the health & wellbeing of our citizenry. https://t.co/QyUgb1hR5C

Our local health centers continue to serve those w/ geographic & economic need. This funding will continue to enhance the availability of quality, affordable, & accessible healthcare in multiple health centers throughout #GA02. https://t.co/POAaGGfDqI

I had the privilege of visiting @MCLBAlbany. I  toured the facilities, assessed recovery efforts & discussed initiatives w/ the MCLB team. I also witnessed the hard work of the Marines & citizens from the community. @MLCBAlbany thank you for your service & hospitality. https://t.co/hcHf8jVWLm
I was honored to receive the 2018 Distinguished Community Health Advocate Award from Albany Area Primary Healthcare, Inc. Thank you for presenting me with this award! https://t.co/Vy9Y5ARI9U
RT @navicenthealth: Huge thanks to @SanfordBishop & @AustinScottGA08 for their support of the #ConnectWell pilot program with @Everyone_On…
The Children’s Health Insurance Program (#CHIP) will be extended into next year. This vital program provides health insurance to 9 million children, including 130,000 children in Georgia.

Happy to attend the Leesburg Train Depot Renovation Project groundbreaking! https://t.co/6ToCDCFYo5

(1/2) I spearheaded a letter to @FERC opposing the #SabalTrail pipeline on #environmental #health concerns. #GA deserves better.
